intro: Malvastrum pucarense, commonly known as the Pucara mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, dry conditions of its native habitat. The leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in fine hairs.
